TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/ScrollBar/ThumbButtonVertical extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of a vertical scroll box (also known as the thumb). This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.ScrollBar.ThumbButtonVertical class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of a vertical scroll box.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ScrollBar.ThumbButtonVertical.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementScrollBarThumbButtonVertical1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#85](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/60c38616-a869-4e5d-818c-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#85](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/60c38616-a869-4e5d-818c-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a vertical scroll box in the disabled state.
Docs.value: A that represents a vertical scroll box in the disabled state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementScrollBarThumbButtonVertical4` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#88](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/f07ce58f-57e4-4e3c-8d2b-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#88](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/f07ce58f-57e4-4e3c-8d2b-_1.vb)]
